A collection of servers or computers that stores resources and data in remote data centers that can be accessed via the internet.
A basic unit of information that travels from one device to another within a network.
The practice of capturing and inspecting network traffic across a network.
correct_answers: A basic unit of information that travels from one device to another within a network.
questions.explanation: A data packet is a basic unit of information that travels from one device to another within a network.

questions.question: 7. What is the second layer of the TCP/IP model?
questions.explanation: The internet layer is the second layer of the TCP/IP model. The internet layer is where IP addresses are attached to data packets to indicate the location of the sender and receiver. The internet layer also focuses on how networks connect to each other.

questions.question: 1. Fill in the blank: An Internet Protocol (IP) address is a unique string of characters that identifies the _____ of a device on the internet.
questions.explanation: An IP address is a unique string of characters that identifies the location of a device on the internet.

questions.question: 2. Which of the following is an example of an IPv4 address?
questions.explanation: An example of an IPv4 address is 172.16.254.1. IPv4 addresses are written as four, 1-3-digit numbers separated by decimal points. Each one can contain the values 0-255.

questions.question: 3. What type of address is assigned by an internet service provider and connected to a geographic location?
questions.explanation: A public IP address is assigned by an internet service provider and shared by all devices on a local area network. It is connected to geographic location. All communications from devices in the same local area have the same public-facing address due to network address translation or a forwarding proxy.

questions.question: 4. Fill in the blank: A switch uses a MAC _____ to direct data packets to the correct device.
questions.explanation: A switch uses a MAC address table to direct data packets to the correct device.

questions.question: 5. Which of the following is an example of an IPv4 address?
questions.explanation: 192.168.1.23 is an example of an IPv4 address. IPv4 addresses have four, 1 to 3 digit numbers separated by decimal points.

questions.question: 1. What is the term for a group of connected devices?
questions.explanation: Correct

questions.question: 2. A _____ broadcasts information to every device on the network.
questions.explanation: Correct

questions.question: 3. Which of the following statements accurately describe switches? Select all that apply.
choices: When a switch receives a data packet, it reads the MAC address of the destination device and maps it to a port.
Switches are less secure than hubs.
Some benefits to switches are effective control of traffic flow and improved network performance.
A switch is a device that makes connections between specific devices on a network by sending and receiving data between them.
correct_answers: When a switch receives a data packet, it reads the MAC address of the destination device and maps it to a port.
Some benefits to switches are effective control of traffic flow and improved network performance.
A switch is a device that makes connections between specific devices on a network by sending and receiving data between them.
questions.explanation: Correct

questions.question: 4. What are some of the benefits cloud service providers (CSPs) offer security professionals? Select all that apply.
choices: CSPs provide business analytics to monitor web traffic and sales.
CSP servers, applications, and network services are hosted on local physical devices.
CSPs can save an organization money by offering processing power that is only paid for as needed.
CSPs offer online services and web applications that can be accessed from any location.
correct_answers: CSPs provide business analytics to monitor web traffic and sales.
CSPs can save an organization money by offering processing power that is only paid for as needed.
CSPs offer online services and web applications that can be accessed from any location.
questions.explanation: Correct

questions.question: 5. What is the purpose of the footer of a data packet?
choices: To contain the source IP address
To show the MAC address of the destination device
To signal to the receiving device that the packet is finished
To identify the message to be transmitted to the receiving device
correct_answers: To signal to the receiving device that the packet is finished
questions.explanation: Correct

questions.question: 6. What are the three main categories of services that CSPs provide? Select all that apply.
choices: Platform as a service (PaaS) ( CORRECT ) Desktop as a service (DaaS)
correct_answers: Platform as a service (PaaS) ( CORRECT ) Desktop as a service (DaaS)
questions.explanation: Correct

questions.question: 7. Which port is used for secure internet communication?
questions.explanation: Correct

questions.question: 8. Which layer in the TCP/IP model is used to inspect the flow of traffic across a network?
questions.explanation: Correct

questions.question: 9. A security analyst runs a command to discover a local IP address. The analyst receives the following result: 169.254.255.249. What type of address is this?
questions.explanation: Correct

questions.question: 10. Which of the following addresses is an accurate IPv6 address?
questions.explanation: Correct

questions.question: 11. Which network device connects multiple networks together?
questions.explanation: Correct

questions.question: 12. What are two benefits of cloud computing and software defined networks (SDNs)? Select two answers.
questions.explanation: Correct

questions.question: 13. Fill in the blank: A computer sends information to the router and the router then transfers information through a ____ to the internet.
questions.explanation: Correct

questions.question: 14. What port number is used for large file transfers?
questions.explanation: Correct

questions.question: 15. Fill in the blank: fe80::ab12:cd34:ef56:0023:2345 is an example of an accurate ___ address.
questions.explanation: Correct

questions.question: 16. Fill in the blank: A ___ is a device that makes connections between specific devices on a local network by sending and receiving data between them.
questions.explanation: Correct

questions.question: 17. A security professional is investigating the benefits and drawbacks of using a cloud service provider (CSP). What are some reasons why the security professional might choose to use a CSP in their work? Select all that apply.
choices: A CSP provides business analytics to monitor web traffic and sales.
CSP services do not require any additional cloud security measures
CSP remote servers allow web applications to be accessed from any location.
A CSP offers processing power that is only paid for as needed.
correct_answers: A CSP provides business analytics to monitor web traffic and sales.
CSP remote servers allow web applications to be accessed from any location.
A CSP offers processing power that is only paid for as needed.
questions.explanation: Correct

questions.question: 18. Which one of the following port numbers is used for email traffic?
questions.explanation: Correct

questions.question: 19. Fill in the blank: The ___ layer is used to determine how data packets will interact with receiving devices, including file transfers and email services.
questions.explanation: Correct

questions.question: 20. Fill in the blank: 127.0.0.1 is an example of an ___ address.
questions.explanation: Correct

questions.question: 21. What is the purpose of the protocol number of a data packet?
choices: To identify the message to be transmitted to the receiving device
To tell the receiving device what to do with the information in the packet
To contain the IP and MAC addresses
To signal to the receiving device that the packet is finished
correct_answers: To tell the receiving device what to do with the information in the packet
questions.explanation: Correct

questions.question: 22. A security analyst runs a command to discover a local IP address. The analyst receives the following result: fd45:3efd:3201:ff22:0000:0000:12ff:0000. What type of address is this?
questions.explanation: Correct

questions.question: 23. Fill in the blank: A ___ is a network that spans a large geographic area, like a city, state, or country.
questions.explanation: Correct

questions.question: 24. A security analyst uses the TCP/IP model to visualize how data is organized and transmitted across their company’s network. The analyst inspects the transmission of data packets, such as the switches that direct data to its destination. Which layer are they investigating?
questions.explanation: Correct

course: Course 3 – Connect and Protect: Networks and Network Security

questions.question: 1. Fill in the blank: Network protocols are rules used by two or more devices on a network to describe the _____ and structure of data.
questions.explanation: Network protocols are rules used by two or more devices on a network to describe the order of delivery and the structure of data.

questions.question: 2. Which network protocol provides a secure method of communication between clients and web servers?
questions.explanation: Hypertext transfer protocol secure (HTTPS) provides a secure method of communication between clients and web servers. HTTPS uses digital certificates to perform authentication and can operate over TCP ports 443 and 80.

questions.question: 3. To keep information safe from malicious actors, what security protocol can be used?
choices: Secure sockets layer and transport layer security (SSL/TLS)
correct_answers: Secure sockets layer and transport layer security (SSL/TLS)
questions.explanation: To keep information safe from malicious actors, SSL/TLS can be used. It secures hypertext transfer protocol (HTTP) transactions, which is known as hypertext transfer protocol secure (HTTPS).

questions.question: 4. IEEE 802.11, also known as Wi-Fi, is a set of standards that define communication for wireless LANs.
questions.explanation: IEEE 802.11, also known as Wi-Fi, is a set of standards that define communication for wireless LANs.

questions.question: 5. Which protocol allows two or more devices to form a connection and stream data?
choices: Domain Name System (DNS) Address Resolution Protocol (ARP)
questions.explanation: TCP is an internet communication protocol that allows two devices to form a connection and stream data.

questions.question: 6. What is IEEE 802.11 commonly known as?
questions.explanation: IEEE 802.11 is commonly known as Wi-Fi. It is a set of standards that define communication for wireless LANs.

questions.question: 1. What monitors and filters traffic coming in and out of a network?
questions.explanation: A firewall monitors and filters traffic coming in and out of a network. It either allows or denies traffic based on a defined set of security rules.

questions.question: 2. Stateless is a class of firewall that keeps track of information passing through it and proactively filters out threats.
questions.explanation: Stateful is a class of firewall that keeps track of information passing through it and proactively filters out threats. Stateless operates based on predefined rules and does not keep track of information from data packets.

questions.question: 3. Fill in the blank: Encapsulation can be performed by a _____ to help protect information by wrapping sensitive data in other data packets.
questions.explanation: Encapsulation can be performed by a VPN service to help protect information by wrapping sensitive data in other data packets. VPNs change a public IP address and hide a virtual location to keep data private when using a public network.

questions.question: 4. Which security zone is used to ensure highly confidential information and is only accessible to employees with certain privileges?
questions.explanation: The restricted zone protects highly confidential information that only people with certain privileges can access. It typically has a separate firewall.

questions.question: 5. Fill in the blank: A security analyst uses a _____ to regulate and restrict access to an internal server from the internet. This tool works by accepting traffic from external parties, approving it, and forwarding it to internal servers.
questions.explanation: A security analyst uses a reverse proxy server to regulate and restrict access to an internal server from the internet. This tool works by accepting traffic from external parties, approving it, and forwarding it to internal servers.

questions.question: 6. Which class of firewall operates based on predefined rules and does not keep track of information from data packets?
questions.explanation: Stateless firewalls are a class of firewall that operates based on predefined rules and does not keep track of information from data packets.

questions.question: 7. Fill in the blank: ____ is a process performed by a VPN service that protects data in transit by wrapping sensitive data in other data packets.
questions.explanation: A VPN service performs encapsulation to protect data in transit. Encapsulation protects data by wrapping it in other data packets.

questions.question: 8. Which of the following areas are in the controlled zone? Select all that apply.
questions.explanation: The DMZ, internal network, and restricted zones are all within the controlled zone. The DMZ contains public-facing services that can access the internet.

questions.question: 9. Fill in the blank: A(n) _____ regulates and restricts the internet’s access to an internal server.
questions.explanation: A reverse proxy server regulates and restricts the internet’s access to an internal server.

questions.question: 1. What internet communication protocol allows two devices to form a connection and stream data?
questions.explanation: Correct

questions.question: 2. What set of standards is known as Wi-Fi?
questions.explanation: Correct

questions.question: 3. Fill in the blank: A ____ firewall can connect to cloud-based threat intelligence services and quickly update against emerging cyber threats
questions.explanation: Correct

questions.question: 4. Fill in the blank: VPN services perform _____ to protect sensitive data by wrapping it in other data packets.
questions.explanation: Correct

questions.question: 5. Fill in the blank. A controlled zone protects a company’s internal network from a(n)___ security zone.
questions.explanation: Correct

questions.question: 6. Which of the following statements accurately describe forward and reverse proxy servers? Select three answers.
choices: Forward proxy servers receive outgoing traffic from an employee, approve it, then forward it to its destination on the internet.
Reverse proxy servers work by hiding a user’s IP address and approving all outgoing requests.
Forward proxy servers regulate and restrict a person’s access to the internet.
Reverse proxy servers accept traffic from external parties, approve it, then forward it to internal servers.
correct_answers: Forward proxy servers receive outgoing traffic from an employee, approve it, then forward it to its destination on the internet.
Forward proxy servers regulate and restrict a person’s access to the internet.
Reverse proxy servers accept traffic from external parties, approve it, then forward it to internal servers.
questions.explanation: Correct

questions.question: 7. What network protocol helps data get to the right place by determining the MAC address of the next router or device on its path?
choices: Address Resolution Protocol (ARP)  Hypertext Transfer Protocol Secure (HTTPS)
correct_answers: Address Resolution Protocol (ARP)  Hypertext Transfer Protocol Secure (HTTPS)
questions.explanation: Correct

questions.question: 8. Fill in the blank: The _______ maintains Wi-Fi standards.
questions.explanation: Correct

questions.question: 9. A firewall administrator installs a firewall function to either block or allow certain port numbers to limit unwanted communication. What function does this scenario describe?
questions.explanation: Correct

questions.question: 10. A security professional sets up a security measure to allow employees to work from home securely while having access to internal network resources. What does this scenario describe?
questions.explanation: Correct

questions.question: 11. Which of the following does encapsulation protect?
questions.explanation: Correct

questions.question: 12. What is the function of the demilitarized zone (DMZ)?
choices: Organize data by forwarding it to other servers
Isolate servers exposed to the internet from the rest of a network
Encrypt data as it travels across the internet
Protect highly confidential information accessible only to employees with certain privileges
correct_answers: Isolate servers exposed to the internet from the rest of a network
questions.explanation: Correct

questions.question: 13. Fill in the blank: A _____ fulfills the requests of its clients by forwarding them to other servers
questions.explanation: Correct

questions.question: 14. How do forward proxy servers secure internal networks? Select two answers.
choices: They receive outgoing traffic from an employee, approve it, then forward it to its destination on the internet.
Both forward and reverse proxy servers add a layer of protection from the internet.
They are useful for protecting internal web servers that contain confidential data.
They hide a user’s IP address and approve all outgoing requests.
correct_answers: They receive outgoing traffic from an employee, approve it, then forward it to its destination on the internet.
They hide a user’s IP address and approve all outgoing requests.
questions.explanation: Correct

questions.question: 15. What network protocol translates the domain name of a website’s server into an IP address?
questions.explanation: Correct

questions.question: 16. Which of the following statements accurately describe wireless protocols? Select three answers.
choices: Wi-Fi protocols provide significantly lower security levels than wired connections.
WPA is a wireless security protocol pertaining to connecting to the internet.
The Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers maintains Wi-Fi standards.
The set of standards IEEE 802.11 is also referred to as Wi-Fi.
correct_answers: WPA is a wireless security protocol pertaining to connecting to the internet.
The Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers maintains Wi-Fi standards.
The set of standards IEEE 802.11 is also referred to as Wi-Fi.
questions.explanation: Correct

questions.question: 17. Fill in the blank: A ____ firewall operates based on predefined rules. It is not used to keep track of information from data packets.
questions.explanation: Correct

questions.question: 18. How do VPNs preserve confidentiality?
choices: Monitor traffic to and from a network
Use temporary memory to store data requested by external servers
Translate internet domain names to IP addresses
questions.explanation: Correct

questions.question: 19. What does a VPN service use to transfer encrypted data between a device and the VPN server?
questions.explanation: Correct

questions.question: 20. What network zone includes public facing services such as web servers, proxy servers, and DNS servers?
questions.explanation: Correct

questions.question: 21. A security analyst implements a proxy server to secure internal networks. What are some of the proxy server’s primary functions? Select three answers.
choices: Use public IP addresses that are different from the rest on the private network
Temporarily stores data that is frequently requested by external servers
Divide the network into segments to maintain privacy within corporate groups
Determine whether requests to connect to a website are allowed
correct_answers: Use public IP addresses that are different from the rest on the private network
Temporarily stores data that is frequently requested by external servers
Determine whether requests to connect to a website are allowed
questions.explanation: Correct

questions.question: 22. Which firewall offers the most security features?
questions.explanation: Correct

questions.question: 23. What network is part of the uncontrolled zone?
questions.explanation: Correct

questions.question: 24. Which type of firewall analyzes network traffic for suspicious characteristics and behavior and stops
questions.explanation: Correct

questions.question: 25. What network zone contains the internet and other services that are outside of an organization’s control?
questions.explanation: Correct

questions.question: 26. What network zone acts as a network perimeter to the internal network by isolating servers that are exposed to the internet?
questions.explanation: Correct

questions.question: 27. Fill in the blank: A ____ accepts traffic from external parties, approves it, then forwards it to internal servers.
questions.explanation: Correct

questions.question: 28. Which of the following types of firewalls can perform deep packet inspection and intrusion detection?
questions.explanation: Correct

course: Course 3 – Connect and Protect: Networks and Network Security

questions.question: 1. What type of attack uses multiple devices or servers in different locations to flood the target network with unwanted traffic?
questions.explanation: A DDoS attack uses multiple devices or servers in different locations to flood the target network with unwanted traffic.

questions.question: 2. What type of attack poses as a TCP connection and floods a server with packets simulating the first step of the TCP handshake?
questions.explanation: A SYN flood attack poses as a TCP connection and floods a server with packets simulating the first step of the TCP handshake. This overwhelms the server, making it unable to function.

questions.question: 3. Fill in the blank: The Denial of Service (DoS) attack _____ is caused when a hacker sends a system an ICMP packet that is bigger than 64KB.
questions.explanation: The DoS attack Ping of Death is caused when a hacker sends a system an ICMP packet that is bigger than 64KB.

questions.question: 4. Which types of attacks take advantage of communication protocols by sending an overwhelming number of requests to a server? Select all that apply.
questions.explanation: ICMP flood and SYN flood attacks take advantage of communication protocols by sending an overwhelming number of requests to a server.

questions.question: 5. Which of the following are common network attacks? Select all that apply.
questions.explanation: Spoofing, packet flooding, and malware are all common network attacks.

questions.question: 6. Fill in the blank: A _____ attack happens when an attacker sends a device or system oversized ICMP packets that are bigger than 64KB.
questions.explanation: A ping of death attack is a type of DOS attack caused when a hacker pings a system by sending it an oversized ICMP packet that is bigger than 64KB.

questions.question: 1. Passive packet sniffing involves data packets being manipulated while in transit, which may include injecting internet protocols to redirect the packets to unintended ports or changing the information the packet contains.
questions.explanation: Active packet sniffing is a type of attack that involves data packets being manipulated while in transit. This can include injecting internet protocols to redirect the packets to unintended ports or changing the information the packet contains. Passive packet sniffing is a type of attack where data packets are read in transit.

questions.question: 2. Fill in the blank: A security analyst can protect against malicious packet sniffing by _____ to encrypt data as it travels across a network.
choices: using only websites with HTTP at the beginning of their domain addresses
questions.explanation: A security analyst can protect against malicious packet sniffing by using a VPN to encrypt data as it travels across a network. A VPN is a network security service that changes a public IP address and hides a virtual location to keep data private when using a public network.

questions.question: 3. Which type of attack involves an attacker changing the source IP of a data packet to impersonate an authorized system and gain access to the network?
questions.explanation: IP spoofing involves an attacker changing the source IP of a data packet to impersonate an authorized system and gain access to the network.

questions.question: 4. Which of the following statements accurately describes a smurf attack?
choices: A DoS attack that is caused when a hacker pings a system by sending it an oversized ICMP packet that is bigger than the maximum size
A network attack performed when an attacker sniffs an authorized user’s IP address and floods it with packets
A DoS attack performed by an attacker repeatedly sending ICMP packets to a network server
A network attack performed when an attacker intercepts a data packet in transit and delays it or repeats it at another time
correct_answers: A network attack performed when an attacker sniffs an authorized user’s IP address and floods it with packets
questions.explanation: A smurf attack is a network attack performed when an attacker sniffs an authorized user’s IP address and floods it with packets. It is a combination of a DDoS attack and an IP spoofing attack.

questions.question: 5. Which part of a data packet may contain valuable information about the data in transit?
questions.explanation: The body of a data packet may contain sensitive information such as credit card numbers, dates of birth, or personal messages. Malicious actors can use the information contained in the body of a data packet to their advantage.

questions.question: 6. Which of the following attacks use IP spoofing? Select three answers.
questions.explanation: Replay attacks, on-path attacks, and smurf attacks are common types of IP spoofing attacks. A smurf attack is when an attacker sniffs an authorized user’s IP address and floods it with packets.

questions.question: 1. What happens during a Denial of Service (DoS) attack?
choices: The target crashes and normal business operations cannot continue.
The data packets containing valuable information are stolen as they travel across the network.
The network is infected with malware.
The attacker successfully impersonates an authorized user and gains access to the network.
correct_answers: The target crashes and normal business operations cannot continue.
questions.explanation: Denial of Service (DoS) (CORRECT) Ping of death SYN flood IP spoofing

questions.question: 2. Which type of attack overloads a network with traffic and overwhelms the target server?
questions.explanation: On-path attack SYN flood attack (CORRECT) Ping of Death ICMP flood

questions.question: 3. A security team discovers that an attacker has taken advantage of the handshake process that is used to establish a TCP connection between a device and their server. Which DoS attack does this scenario describe?
questions.explanation: SYN flood smurf on-path Ping of Death (CORRECT)

questions.question: 4. Which type of attack occurs when a malicious actor sends an oversized ICMP packet to a server?
questions.explanation: Active packet sniffing may enable attackers to redirect the packets to unintended ports. (CORRECT) The purpose of passive packet sniffing is to read data packets while in transit. (CORRECT) Passive packet sniffing may enable attackers to change the information a packet contains. Using only websites with HTTPS at the beginning of their domain names provides protection from packet sniffing. (CORRECT)

questions.question: 5. Which of the following statements Correct ly describe passive and active packet sniffing? Select three answers.
choices: Active packet sniffing may enable attackers to redirect the packets to unintended ports.
The purpose of passive packet sniffing is to read data packets while in transit.
Passive packet sniffing may enable attackers to change the information a packet contains.
Using only websites with HTTPS at the beginning of their domain names provides protection from packet sniffing.
correct_answers: Active packet sniffing may enable attackers to redirect the packets to unintended ports.
The purpose of passive packet sniffing is to read data packets while in transit.
Using only websites with HTTPS at the beginning of their domain names provides protection from packet sniffing.
questions.explanation: IP spoofing (CORRECT) Ping of death Packet sniffing SYN flooding

questions.question: 6. As a security professional, you research on-path, replay, and smurf attacks in order to implement procedures that will protect your company from these incidents. What type of attack are you learning about?
questions.explanation: firewall (CORRECT) demilitarized zone HTTPS domain address VPN

questions.question: 7. Fill in the blank: To reduce the chances of an IP spoofing attack, a security analyst can configure a _____ to reject all incoming traffic with the same source IP addresses as those owned by the organization.
questions.explanation: Malware attack On-path attack (CORRECT) Smurf attack Packet flooding attack

questions.question: 8. Fill in the blank: In a/an ____ attack, a malicious actor places themselves in the middle of an authorized connection and intercepts the data in transit.
questions.explanation: replay (CORRECT) smurf on-path SYN flood

questions.question: 9. Fill in the blank: The _____ network attack occurs when an attacker intercepts a data packet in transit, then repeats it at another time.
questions.explanation: On-path attack Replay attack Smurf attack (CORRECT) Ping of Death

questions.question: 10. Fill in the blank: A ___ attack happens when a malicious actor sniffs an authorized user’s IP address and floods it with packets.
questions.explanation: Repeatedly send ICMP packets to a network server Simulate a TCP connection and flood a server with SYN packets Disrupt normal business operations (CORRECT) Send oversized ICMP packets

questions.question: 11. What is the main objective of a Denial of Service (DoS) attack?
choices: Repeatedly send ICMP packets to a network server
Simulate a TCP connection and flood a server with SYN packets
questions.explanation: Ping of Death On-path attack ICMP flood attack SYN flood attack (CORRECT)

questions.question: 12. A security team investigates a server that has been overwhelmed with SYN packets. What does this scenario describe?
questions.explanation: 64TB 15Gb 64KB (CORRECT) 32KB

questions.question: 13. Fill in the blank: The maximum size of a Correct ly formatted IPv4 ICMP packet is _____, as opposed to the oversized packet that is sent during a Ping of Death attack.
questions.explanation: Passive packet sniffing (CORRECT) Active packet sniffing IP packet interception Hardware packet sniffing

questions.question: 14. Which type of packet sniffing allows malicious actors to view and read data packets in transit?
questions.explanation: IP spoofing (CORRECT) Passive packet sniffing Active packet sniffing Ping of Death

questions.question: 15. Fill in the blank: In a _____ attack, an attacker changes the source IP of a data packet to impersonate an authorized system and gain access to a network.
questions.explanation: on-path attacks (CORRECT) replay attacks (CORRECT) smurf attacks (CORRECT) KRACK attacks

questions.question: 16. What are some common IP spoofing attacks? Select all that apply.
questions.explanation: Smurf attack On-path attack (CORRECT) Malware attack Packet flooding attack

questions.question: 17. A malicious actor impersonates a web browser or web server by placing themselves between two devices, then sniffing the packet information to discover the IP and MAC addresses. Which type of attack is this?
questions.explanation: Smurf attack (CORRECT) On-path attack Replay attack Ping of Death

questions.question: 18. Which attack involves an attacker sniffing an authorized user’s IP address and flooding it with packets?
questions.explanation: Commonly used software applications The personal information of employees All hardware within an organization Network bandwidth (CORRECT)

questions.question: 19. What do network-level Denial of Service (DoS) attacks target?
questions.explanation: SYN flood replay (CORRECT) smurf on-path

questions.question: 20. A malicious actor intercepts a network transmission that was sent by an authorized user and repeats it at a later time to impersonate a user. Which type of attack is this?
questions.explanation: Smurf attack (CORRECT) Ping of Death On-path attack Replay attack

questions.question: 21. A malicious actor takes down a network by flooding an authorized user’s IP address with packets. Which type of DDoS attack is this?
questions.explanation: Distributed Denial of Service (DDoS) Tailgating Ping of death ICMP flood

questions.question: 22. Fill in the blank: A _____ attack uses multiple devices in different locations to flood the target network with unwanted traffic.
questions.explanation: IP spoofing (CORRECT) A DoS attack A KRACK attack SYN flooding

questions.question: 23. Fill in the blank: _____ is a network attack performed when an attacker changes the source IP of a data packet to impersonate an authorized system and gain access to a network.
questions.explanation: Previous Module Next Module

course: Course 3 – Connect and Protect: Networks and Network Security

questions.question: 1. Fill in the blank: The _____ acts as an intermediary between software applications and computer hardware.
questions.explanation: The operating system acts as an intermediary between software applications and computer hardware.

questions.question: 2. Which of the following activities are security hardening tasks? Select all that apply.
choices: Disposing of hardware and software properly
correct_answers: Disposing of hardware and software properly
questions.explanation: Making patch updates, disposing of hardware and software properly, and enforcing password policies are security hardening tasks. Security hardening is the process of strengthening a system to reduce its vulnerability and attack surface.

questions.question: 3. Multifactor authentication (MFA) is a security measure that requires a user to verify their identity in at least two ways before they can access a system or network.
questions.explanation: MFA is a security measure that requires a user to verify their identity in at least two ways before they can access a system or network.

questions.question: 4. What are examples of physical security hardening? Select all that apply.
questions.explanation: Physical security is also a part of security hardening and may include securing a physical space with security cameras and security guards.

questions.question: 5. Fill in the blank: ____ refers to all the potential vulnerabilities a threat actor could potentially exploit in a system.
questions.explanation: An attack surface is all the potential vulnerabilities a threat actor could potentially exploit in a system.

questions.question: 6. In network security, why is it important to secure operating systems (OS) on each device?
choices: To prevent the whole network being compromised by one insecure OS
To provide employees the latest programs and features
To identify all vulnerabilities present in systems, networks, websites, applications, and processes
To reduce human error across an organization
correct_answers: To prevent the whole network being compromised by one insecure OS
questions.explanation: It’s important to secure the OS on each device because one insecure OS could lead to the whole network being compromised.

questions.question: 1. Fill in the blank: Security teams can use _____ to examine network logs and identify events of interest.
choices: security information and event management (SIEM) tools
correct_answers: security information and event management (SIEM) tools
questions.explanation: Security teams can use security information and event management (SIEM) tools to examine network logs and identify events of interest. SIEM tools collect and analyze log data to monitor critical activities in an organization.

questions.question: 2. What is a basic principle of port filtering?
choices: Allow ports that are used by normal network operations.
Disallow ports that are used by normal network operations.
Block all ports in a network.
Allow users access to only areas of the network that are required for their role.
correct_answers: Allow ports that are used by normal network operations.
questions.explanation: A basic principle of port filtering is to allow ports that are used by normal network operations. Any port that is not being used by the normal network operations should be disallowed to protect against vulnerabilities.

questions.question: 3. A security professional creates different subnets for the various departments in their business, ensuring users have access that is appropriate for their particular roles. What does this scenario describe?
questions.explanation: This scenario describes network segmentation, which involves creating isolated subnets for different departments in an organization.

questions.question: 4. Data in restricted zones should have the same encryption standards as data in other zones.
questions.explanation: Restricted zones on a network, which contain highly classified or confidential data, should have much higher encryption standards than data in other zones to make them more difficult to access.

questions.question: 5. Fill in the blank: A _____ is an application that collects and analyzes log data to monitor critical activities in an organization.
choices: Security Information and Event Management tool (SIEM)
correct_answers: Security Information and Event Management tool (SIEM)
questions.explanation: A SIEM tool is an application that collects and analyzes log data to monitor critical activities in an organization.

questions.question: 1. Fill in the blank: A key distinction between cloud and traditional network hardening is the use of a server baseline image, which enables security analysts to prevent _____ by comparing data in cloud servers to the baseline image.
questions.explanation: A key distinction between cloud and traditional network hardening is the use of a server baseline image, which enables security analysts to prevent unverified changes by comparing data in cloud servers to the baseline image.

questions.question: 2. Data and applications on cloud networks do not need to be separated based on their service category, such as their age or internal functionality.
questions.explanation: Similar to OS hardening, data and applications on a cloud network should be kept separate depending on their service category. For example, older applications should be kept separate from new applications. And software that deals with internal functions should be kept separate from front-end applications seen by users.

questions.question: 3. Who is responsible for ensuring the safety of cloud networks? Select all that apply.
questions.explanation: Both the organization’s security team and its cloud service provider are responsible for ensuring the safety of cloud networks.

questions.question: 4. Fill in the blank: _____ cloud services are a common source of cloud security issues.
questions.explanation: Misconfigured cloud services are a common source of cloud security issues. An improperly configured service could allow unauthorized users to have access to critical cloud operations.

questions.question: 5. What services can cloud networks usually provide to their customers?
choices: Eliminate the need to set cloud configurations
Fix security vulnerabilities within company applications
questions.explanation: Cloud networks can host company data and applications using cloud computing to provide on-demand storage, processing power, and data analytics.

questions.question: 1. What are the purposes of performing a patch update for security hardening? Select all that apply.
choices: Requiring a user to verify their identity to access a system or network.
Fixing known security vulnerabilities in a network or services.
Preventing malicious actors from flooding a network.
Upgrading an operating system to the latest software version.
correct_answers: Fixing known security vulnerabilities in a network or services.
Upgrading an operating system to the latest software version.
questions.explanation: virtual physical (CORRECT) cloud-based network-focused

questions.question: 2. Fill in the blank: Requiring employees to turn off their personal devices while in secure areas is an example of a _____ security hardening practice.
questions.explanation: The Ping of Death Penetration testing (CORRECT) A Distributed Denial of Service (DDoS) attack Packet sniffing

questions.question: 3. An organization’s in-house security team has been authorized to simulate an attack on the organization’s website. The objective is to identify any vulnerabilities that are present. What does this scenario describe?
choices: A Distributed Denial of Service (DDoS) attack
questions.explanation: Removing unused software to limit unnecessary vulnerabilities (CORRECT) Configuring a device setting to fit a secure encryption standard (CORRECT) Keeping an up-to-date list of authorized users. (CORRECT) Implementing an intrusion detection system (IDS)

questions.question: 4. What are some methods for hardening operating systems? Select three answers.
choices: Removing unused software to limit unnecessary vulnerabilities
Configuring a device setting to fit a secure encryption standard
Keeping an up-to-date list of authorized users.
correct_answers: Removing unused software to limit unnecessary vulnerabilities
Configuring a device setting to fit a secure encryption standard
Keeping an up-to-date list of authorized users.
questions.explanation: network segment virtual private network installation baseline configuration (CORRECT) internet control message protocol update

questions.question: 5. Fill in the blank: A/An _____ is a documented set of specifications within a system that is used as a basis for future builds, releases, and updates
questions.explanation: Patch updates SIEM Port filtering Multi-factor authentication (MFA) (CORRECT)

questions.question: 6. Which OS hardening practice requires users to verify their identity in two or more ways to access a system or network?
questions.explanation: By increasing the attack surface within a business network By creating isolated subnets for each of the various departments within an organization By helping analysts inspect, analyze, and react to security events based on their priority By blocking or allowing certain port numbers in order to limit unwanted communication (CORRECT)

questions.question: 7. In what way might port filtering be used to protect a network from an attack?
choices: By increasing the attack surface within a business network
By creating isolated subnets for each of the various departments within an organization
By helping analysts inspect, analyze, and react to security events based on their priority
By blocking or allowing certain port numbers in order to limit unwanted communication
correct_answers: By blocking or allowing certain port numbers in order to limit unwanted communication
questions.explanation: penetration testing network segmentation (CORRECT) cloud hardening patch updating

questions.question: 8. Fill in the blank: Security analysts use ____ to create isolated subnets for different departments in an organization.
questions.explanation: Security hardening (CORRECT) Network hardening Port filtering SIEM

questions.question: 9. Fill in the blank: ____ is the process of strengthening a system to reduce its vulnerability and attack surface.
questions.explanation: Security hardening expands the attack surface. Security hardening increases the attack surface. Security hardening diminishes the attack surface. (CORRECT) Security hardening permanently eliminates the attack surface.

questions.question: 10. What is the relationship between security hardening and an attack surface?
choices: Security hardening expands the attack surface.
Security hardening increases the attack surface.
Security hardening diminishes the attack surface.
Security hardening permanently eliminates the attack surface.
correct_answers: Security hardening diminishes the attack surface.
questions.explanation: Packet sniffing A Distributed Denial of Service (DDoS) attack Penetration testing (CORRECT) The Ping of Death

questions.question: 11. A company’s executive team approves a proposal by the security director. The proposal involves security professionals simulating an attack on the company’s systems in order to identify vulnerabilities. What does this scenario describe?
choices: A Distributed Denial of Service (DDoS) attack
questions.explanation: Multi-factor authentication is a security measure requiring users to change passwords every month. When disposing of software, it is a best practice to delete any unused applications. (CORRECT) OS hardening is a set of procedures that maintain and improve OS security. (CORRECT) Some OS hardening tasks are performed at regular intervals, while others are performed only once. (CORRECT)

questions.question: 12. Which of the following statements accurately describe OS hardening tasks? Select three answers.
choices: Multi-factor authentication is a security measure requiring users to change passwords every month.
When disposing of software, it is a best practice to delete any unused applications.
OS hardening is a set of procedures that maintain and improve OS security.
Some OS hardening tasks are performed at regular intervals, while others are performed only once.
correct_answers: When disposing of software, it is a best practice to delete any unused applications.
OS hardening is a set of procedures that maintain and improve OS security.
Some OS hardening tasks are performed at regular intervals, while others are performed only once.
questions.explanation: Checking baseline configuration (CORRECT) Performing port filtering over network ports Verifying user identity when accessing an OS Conducting a network log analysis

questions.question: 13. Which OS hardening practice involves a security analyst comparing the current configuration to existing documentation about the OS?
choices: Performing port filtering over network ports
Verifying user identity when accessing an OS
questions.explanation: Penetration testing Network segmentation (CORRECT) Patch updating Cloud hardening

questions.question: 14. Which network hardening practice is used to create isolated subnets for different departments in an organization?
questions.explanation: SIEM patch update cloud network (CORRECT) baseline configuration

questions.question: 15. Fill in the blank: A ____ is a collection of servers or computers that stores resources and data in remote data centers that can be accessed via the internet
questions.explanation: Hide the attack surface Augment the attack surface Mirror the attack surface Reduce the attack surface (CORRECT)

questions.question: 16. When performing security hardening, what is the goal with regards to the attack surface?
questions.explanation: software-based physical (CORRECT) virtual network-focused

questions.question: 17. Fill in the blank: Installing security cameras is an example of a _____ security hardening practice.
questions.explanation: A firewall function that blocks or allows certain port numbers in order to limit unwanted network traffic (CORRECT) A security protocol that provides an encrypted tunnel for issuing commands from a remote server A security technique that divides a network into segments A process performed by a VPN service that protects data by wrapping it in other data packets

questions.question: 18. Which of the following statements accurately describes port filtering?
choices: A firewall function that blocks or allows certain port numbers in order to limit unwanted network traffic
A security protocol that provides an encrypted tunnel for issuing commands from a remote server
A security technique that divides a network into segments
A process performed by a VPN service that protects data by wrapping it in other data packets
correct_answers: A firewall function that blocks or allows certain port numbers in order to limit unwanted network traffic
questions.explanation: software-based virtual physical (CORRECT) network-focused

questions.question: 19. Fill in the blank: Hiring a security guard is an example of a _____ security hardening practice.
questions.explanation: A Distributed Denial of Service (DDoS) attack Penetration testing (CORRECT) The Ping of Death Packet sniffing

questions.question: 20. To help improve the security of a business, its in-house security team is approved to simulate an attack that will identify vulnerabilities in business processes. What does this scenario describe?
choices: A Distributed Denial of Service (DDoS) attack
questions.explanation: Checking baseline configuration (CORRECT) Responsibly managing applications Upgrading the interface between computer hardware and the user Verifying user identity when accessing an OS

questions.question: 21. A security analyst reviews documentation about a firewall rule that includes a list of allowed and disallowed network ports. They compare it to the current firewall to ensure no changes have been made. What does this scenario describe?
choices: Upgrading the interface between computer hardware and the user
Verifying user identity when accessing an OS
questions.explanation: password policy multifactor authentication (MFA) (CORRECT) network log analysis baseline configuration

questions.question: 22. Fill in the blank: The security measure _____ requires a user to verify their identity in two or more ways to access a system or network.
questions.explanation: Network segmentation (CORRECT) Cloud hardening Penetration testing Patch updating

questions.question: 23. A security team considers the best way to handle the different security zones within their network. They prioritize protecting the restricted zone by separating from the rest of the network and ensuring it has much higher encryption standards. What does this scenario describe?
questions.explanation: Installing security cameras Regularly installing updates (CORRECT) Using secure encryption standards (CORRECT) Implementing multifactor authentication (CORRECT)

questions.question: 24. Which of the following are OS hardening tasks? Select three answers.
questions.explanation: In both, all applications are stored together, regardless of their age. They both require proper maintenance and security hardening. (CORRECT) They both use baseline images stored in the cloud to compare data. In both, all data and application are stored together, regardless of their service category.

questions.question: 25. What is one key similarity between regular web servers and cloud servers?
choices: In both, all applications are stored together, regardless of their age.
They both require proper maintenance and security hardening.
They both use baseline images stored in the cloud to compare data.
In both, all data and application are stored together, regardless of their service category.
correct_answers: They both require proper maintenance and security hardening.
questions.explanation: Previous Module Next Course

course: Course 3 – Connect and Protect: Networks and Network Security

questions.question: 1. What is an operating system?
choices: The interface between the computer hardware and the user
The physical components of a computer
correct_answers: The interface between the computer hardware and the user
questions.explanation: An operating system is the interface between computer hardware and the user.

questions.question: 2. Which of the following are operating systems? Select all that apply.
questions.explanation: Android, Linux, and Windows are operating systems. Operating systems are interfaces between computer hardware and the user.

questions.question: 3. Which of the following statements correctly describe operating systems? Select all that apply.
choices: Operating systems are the physical components of a computer.
Operating systems help people interact with computers.
Computers run efficiently because of operating systems.
Operating systems are able to run many applications at once.
correct_answers: Operating systems help people interact with computers.
Computers run efficiently because of operating systems.
Operating systems are able to run many applications at once.
questions.explanation: Operating systems help people interact with computers, and computers run efficiently because of operating systems. Operating systems are able to run many applications at once.

questions.question: 4. Computers communicate in a language called binary, which consists of 0s and 1s.
questions.explanation: Computers communicate in a language called binary, which consists of 0s and 1s.

questions.question: 5. Which of the following statements accurately describes operating systems? Select three answers.
choices: Operating systems help humans and computers communicate with each other.
Operating systems consist of physical components.
Maintaining the security of an operating system is critical for the security of a computer.
Operating systems allow users to run multiple applications at once.
correct_answers: Operating systems help humans and computers communicate with each other.
Maintaining the security of an operating system is critical for the security of a computer.
Operating systems allow users to run multiple applications at once.
questions.explanation: Operating systems help humans and computers communicate and allow users to run multiple applications at once. Maintaining the security of an operating system is also critical for the security of a computer.

questions.question: 1. What is the job of a computer’s operating system?
choices: Help other computer programs run efficiently
correct_answers: Help other computer programs run efficiently
questions.explanation: The job of a computer operating system is to help make other computer programs run efficiently. It does this by managing the details related to controlling computer hardware.

questions.question: 2. Fill in the blank: In order to carry out tasks on a computer, users directly interact with _____.
questions.explanation: Users interact with applications in order to carry out tasks on a computer. Applications are programs that perform a specific task.

questions.question: 3. The management of a computer’s resources and memory is handled by an application.
questions.explanation: The management of a computer’s resources and memory is handled by its operating system. The operating system ensures the limited capacity of the computer system is used where it’s needed most.

questions.question: 4. Which of the following processes are part of starting an operating system? Select all that apply.
choices: Either the BIOS or UEFI microchip is activated when a user turns on a computer.
The bootloader immediately launches when a user turns on a computer.
The bootloader starts the operating system.
The BIOS or UEFI microchip loads the bootloader.
correct_answers: Either the BIOS or UEFI microchip is activated when a user turns on a computer.
The bootloader starts the operating system.
The BIOS or UEFI microchip loads the bootloader.
questions.explanation: Either the BIOS or UEFI microchip is activated when a user turns on a computer. The BIOS or UEFI microchip loads the bootloader, and the bootloader starts the operating system.

questions.question: 5. How do applications and hardware communicate?
choices: Operating systems regularly monitor applications and hardware to determine if any common information should be shared between them.
Applications send requests directly to the hardware, and the hardware sends back a response through the operating system.
Applications send requests to the operating system, and the operating system directs those requests to the hardware.
Applications and hardware communicate directly, and the operating system interprets this communication to translate it to the user.
correct_answers: Applications send requests to the operating system, and the operating system directs those requests to the hardware.
questions.explanation: Applications send requests to the operating system, and the operating system directs those requests to the hardware. The hardware also sends information back to the operating system, and the operating system sends it back to applications.

questions.question: 6. Why is it necessary for the OS to handle resource and memory management?
choices: To ensure the limited capacity of the computer system is used where it is needed most
To most efficiently respond to cybersecurity incidents
To track the computer system’s activity and provide users with memory and task management information
To increase the capacity of the computer system so more applications can be run
correct_answers: To ensure the limited capacity of the computer system is used where it is needed most
questions.explanation: The OS handles resource and memory management to ensure the limited capacity of the computer system is used where it is needed most.

questions.question: 1. What is a GUI?
choices: A user interface that runs only on Linux operating systems
A user interface that only runs on mobile devices
A user interface that enables people to manage tasks on a computer using icons
A user interface that allows people to interact with a computer through commands
correct_answers: A user interface that enables people to manage tasks on a computer using icons
questions.explanation: A GUI, or graphical user interface, is a user interface that enables people to manage tasks on a computer using icons. Most operating systems can be used with a GUI.

questions.question: 2. Which of the following can be components of a GUI? Select all that apply.
questions.explanation: A task bar is a common component of a GUI.

questions.question: 3. Fill in the blank: A security professional uses a(n) _____ to interact with a computer using text-based instructions.
questions.explanation: A security professional uses a CLI, or command-line interface, to interact with a computer using text-based instructions.

questions.question: 4. A useful feature of a CLI is that it records a history file of commands and actions.
questions.explanation: A useful feature of a CLI is that it records a history file of commands and actions. This can help security analysts confirm that they used the correct commands from a playbook. It also might help them trace the actions of an attacker.

questions.question: 5. Which of these statements accurately describes a CLI?
choices: A CLI allows users to enter commands that can perform multiple tasks simultaneously.
A CLI uses icons on the screen to make task management more efficient.
A CLI includes a start menu for users to search for applications.
A CLI is familiar to most users because it is commonly used in cell phones and personal computers.
correct_answers: A CLI allows users to enter commands that can perform multiple tasks simultaneously.
questions.explanation: A CLI allows users to enter commands that can perform multiple tasks simultaneously.

questions.question: 1. Which of the following statements accurately describe operating systems? Select all that apply.
choices: Computers, smartphones, and tablets all have operating systems.
Operating systems only permit one application to run at a time.
Operating systems are responsible for making computers run efficiently.
Operating systems are the interfaces between computer hardware and user.
correct_answers: Computers, smartphones, and tablets all have operating systems.
Operating systems are responsible for making computers run efficiently.
Operating systems are the interfaces between computer hardware and user.
questions.explanation: macOS® (CORRECT) Windows (CORRECT) PC Linux (CORRECT)

questions.question: 2. Which of the following are common operating systems? Select three answers.
questions.explanation: The bootloader (CORRECT) An anti-virus application UEFI The user interface

questions.question: 3. What does BIOS load in order to start an operating system?
questions.explanation: the CPU the bootloader anti-virus software applications (CORRECT)

questions.question: 4. Fill in the blank: To complete tasks on their computers, users interact with  ____.
questions.explanation: The hardware would determine the answer and send it back to the operating system. (CORRECT) The application would send this request to the operating system. (CORRECT) The hardware would send the answer directly back to the application. You would type in the number you wanted to calculate into the application. (CORRECT)

questions.explanation: In conclusion, this comprehensive exploration of operating systems has provided participants with a profound understanding of the intricate interplay between hardware, software, and operating systems. The meticulously designed course has successfully demystified the fundamental roles and functionalities of operating systems, empowering learners to navigate the complexities inherent in the interaction between hardware and software components. Through recognition and exploration of prevalent operating systems in today’s technological landscape, participants have gained practical insights into the features and applications that shape contemporary computing environments. The module further illuminated the diverse interfaces facilitating user-OS interaction, offering in-depth insights into both graphical user interfaces (GUI) and command-line interfaces (CLI). Learners now possess the knowledge and skills to proficiently navigate, control, and optimize operating systems through these interfaces. By incorporating real-world examples and practical demonstrations, the course not only ensured a solid grasp of theoretical concepts but also equipped participants with tangible skills crucial for effectively leveraging operating systems. In essence, this comprehensive overview stands as an indispensable resource for individuals seeking a robust understanding of operating systems and their pivotal role in shaping the landscape of modern computing. Participants are now well-prepared to apply their newfound knowledge and skills in real-world scenarios, enhancing their ability to navigate and harness the power of operating systems in diverse technological contexts.

course: Course 4 – Tools of the Trade: Linux and SQL

questions.question: 1. As a security analyst, you might use Linux to review logs when investigating an issue.
questions.explanation: As a security analyst, you might use Linux to review logs when investigating an issue. Another reason you might use Linux is to verify access and authorization.

questions.question: 2. Which of the following are components of the Linux architecture? Select all that apply.
questions.explanation: Components of the Linux architecture include applications, the shell, and the kernel. The user, the Filesystem Hierarchy Standard (FHS), and hardware are also components of the Linux architecture.

questions.question: 3. Fill in the blank: The Filesystem Hierarchy Standard (FHS) is the component of Linux architecture that _____.
choices: enables people to communicate with the system
consists of the physical components of a computer
questions.explanation: The Filesystem Hierarchy Standard (FHS) is the component of the Linux OS that organizes data.

questions.question: 4. Which of the following hardware components are peripheral devices? Select all that apply.
questions.explanation: Monitors and printers are peripheral devices. Peripheral devices are hardware components that are attached and controlled by the computer system. The CPU and RAM are internal hardware. Internal hardware are the components required to run the computer.

questions.question: 5. How do security analysts use Linux? Select three answers.
choices: To verify access and authorization in an identity and access management system
To use digital forensic tools to investigate what happened following an event
To develop new versions of the Linux kernel to increase security in a system
To examine different types of logs to identify what is going on in a system
correct_answers: To verify access and authorization in an identity and access management system
To use digital forensic tools to investigate what happened following an event
To examine different types of logs to identify what is going on in a system
questions.explanation: Security analysts use Linux to verify access and authorization in an identity and access management system. They also use Linux to examine logs and to investigate what happened in an event.

questions.question: 6. What is the kernel’s role in the Linux operating system?
choices: It processes commands and outputs the results.
questions.explanation: The kernel is the component of the Linux OS that manages processes and memory.

questions.question: 1. Fill in the blank: Because the _____ is open source, anyone can modify it to build new Linux distributions.
questions.explanation: Because the kernel is open source, anyone can modify it to build new Linux distributions. The kernel is the component of the Linux OS that manages processes and memory.

questions.question: 2. What is KALI LINUX ™?
choices: A tool used to guess passwords
A Debian-derived, open-source distribution of Linux designed for security tasks
A tool with a graphical user interface that can be used to analyze live and captured network traffic
A subscription-based Linux distribution built for enterprise use
correct_answers: A Debian-derived, open-source distribution of Linux designed for security tasks
questions.explanation: KALI LINUX ™ is a Debian-derived, open-source distribution of Linux designed for security tasks, such as penetration testing and digital forensics.

questions.question: (KALI LINUX ™ is a trademark of OffSec.)
choices: A tool used to guess passwords
A Debian-derived, open-source distribution of Linux designed for security tasks
A tool with a graphical user interface that can be used to analyze live and captured network traffic
A subscription-based Linux distribution built for enterprise use
correct_answers: A Debian-derived, open-source distribution of Linux designed for security tasks
questions.explanation: KALI LINUX ™ is a Debian-derived, open-source distribution of Linux designed for security tasks, such as penetration testing and digital forensics.

questions.question: 3. What is an open-source, user-friendly distribution derived from Debian that is widely used in security and other industries?
questions.explanation: Ubuntu is an open-source, user-friendly distribution derived from Debian that is widely used in security and other industries. Because of its wide use, Ubuntu has a large number of community resources to support users.

questions.question: 4. Which of the following are distributions of Linux? Select all that apply.
questions.explanation: Red Hat, CentOS, and Parrot are all distributions of Linux.

questions.question: 5. What type of components might be different from one Linux distribution to another? Select three answers.
questions.explanation: The pre-installed programs, user interfaces, and parent distributions might differ from one Linux distribution to another.

questions.question: 6. Which of the following statements accurately describe the KALI LINUX ™ distribution? Select all that apply.
choices: It contains many pre-installed tools that can be used for cybersecurity tasks.
It should be used on a virtual machine.
correct_answers: It contains many pre-installed tools that can be used for cybersecurity tasks.
It should be used on a virtual machine.
questions.explanation: KALI LINUX ™ is a Debian-derived distribution, it contains many pre-installed tools for cybersecurity tasks, and it should be used on a virtual machine. It is an open-source distribution.

questions.question: 1. What is the shell?
choices: Data consisting of an ordered sequence of characters
Information received by the operating system (OS) via the command line
An instruction telling the computer to do something
questions.explanation: The shell is the command-line interpreter. It processes commands and outputs the results.

questions.question: 2. After a user inputs a command into the shell, what can the shell return to the user? Select two answers.
choices: A request for more input from the user
questions.explanation: After a user inputs a command into the shell, the shell can return output or an error message to the user. Output is the computer’s response to the user’s input. An error message occurs when the shell cannot interpret the input.

questions.question: 3. What is standard error in Linux?
choices: Information received by the operating system via the command line
Information returned by the operating system through the shell
Error messages returned by the operating system through the shell
A Linux command that outputs a specified string of text
correct_answers: Error messages returned by the operating system through the shell
questions.explanation: Standard error contains error messages returned by the OS through the shell.

questions.question: 4. What is the difference between standard input and standard output?
choices: Standard input is sent to the operating system. Standard output is sent from the operating system.
Standard input is sent from the operating system. Standard output is sent to the operation system.
Standard input is sent to the Filesystem Hierarchy Standard (FHS). Standard output is sent from the FHS.
Standard input is sent from the Filesystem Hierarchy Standard (FHS). Standard output is sent to the FHS.
correct_answers: Standard input is sent to the operating system. Standard output is sent from the operating system.
questions.explanation: Standard input is sent to the operating system. Standard output is sent from the operating system.

questions.question: 5. What is the purpose of the shell?
choices: It activates the Linux operating system.
It helps humans and computers communicate with each other.
It instructs the computer to do something.
correct_answers: It helps humans and computers communicate with each other.
questions.explanation: The shell helps humans and computers communicate with each other. It is the command-line interpreter and helps humans communicate with the operating system through the command line.

questions.question: 6. What can the shell return after a user types a command?
questions.explanation: After a user types a command into the shell, the shell can return either standard output or standard error. Standard output is information returned by the OS through the shell. Standard error contains error messages returned by the OS through the shell.

questions.explanation: In conclusion, this comprehensive exploration of the Linux operating system equips participants with a deep understanding of its pivotal role in the realm of cybersecurity. The module meticulously guides learners through fundamental Linux concepts, offering insights into its architecture and providing an overview of widely used Linux distributions. This foundational knowledge establishes a robust base for comprehending the diverse applications of Linux in various cybersecurity scenarios. A significant emphasis is placed on the exploration of the Linux shell, a dynamic interface enabling direct communication with the operating system. Participants gain hands-on experience navigating the command-line interface, honing their skills for efficient and precise interactions with the Linux operating system. As this module concludes, learners not only acquire proficiency in Linux architecture and distributions but also emerge adept at utilizing the Linux shell as a powerful tool in the cybersecurity toolkit. This comprehensive overview ensures that participants not only grasp theoretical knowledge but also cultivate practical skills, laying the groundwork for their successful integration of Linux in diverse cybersecurity contexts.
