questions.question: 24. Fill in the blank: The _____ is a standard awareness document that lists the top 10 most critical security risks to web applications.
questions.explanation: Conducting an internet search (CORRECT) Checking an organization’s blog Asking friends or family members Asking social media friends

questions.question: 25. Fill in the blank: _____ for the name of the CISO of an organization is a good first step to finding a CISO to follow on social media.
questions.explanation: Networking on social media (CORRECT) Asking friends and family members who are not in the security industry for introductions Knocking door-to-door Staying away from social media

questions.question: 26. Fill in the blank: _____ is a great way to connect to other security professionals in the industry.
choices: Asking friends and family members who are not in the security industry for introductions
questions.explanation: In conclusion, the journey through this comprehensive cybersecurity program has equipped participants with a robust foundation in various aspects of cybersecurity. From understanding the fundamentals of networks and operating systems to mastering incident response and engaging with the cybersecurity community, learners have gained a diverse skill set essential for a successful career in cybersecurity. The emphasis on hands-on experience, practical tools, and real-world scenarios ensures that participants are not only knowledgeable in theory but also capable of applying their skills in practical, industry-relevant situations. As participants conclude this program, they are well-prepared to navigate the complex and ever-evolving landscape of cybersecurity, armed with the expertise needed to address emerging threats and contribute effectively to the security of digital ecosystems.

course: Course 8 – Put It to Work: Prepare for Cybersecurity Jobs

module: Module 5: Find and Apply for Cybersecurity Jobs

questions.question: 1. Which of the following strategies are effective ways to prepare for a job interview? Select three answers.
choices: Call the chief information security officer
Practice describing your skills and experiences
correct_answers: Practice describing your skills and experiences
questions.explanation: Reviewing the job description and your resume are effective way to prepare for a job interview. It’s also helpful to practice describing your skills and experiences.

questions.question: 2. Which of the following actions should you take before a video interview to prevent technical difficulties during the interview? Select two answers.
choices: Install the required video conference application
correct_answers: Install the required video conference application
questions.explanation: Testing video and audio settings and installing the required video conference application are effective ways to prevent technical difficulties during a video interview.

questions.question: 3. Fill in the blank: Establishing _____ with the interviewer is an important step to take and can help you leave a positive impression with the interviewer.
questions.explanation: A rapport is a friendly relationship in which the people involved understand each other’s ideas and communicate well with each other. Building rapport with an interviewer can help you leave a positive impression with the interviewer.

questions.question: 4. Which of the following post-interview practices is an effective way to stand out as a candidate?
choices: Ask the interviewer how other candidates did during their interviews
Send a follow-up email to the interviewer ( CORRECT)
Send a gift to the interviewer
correct_answers: Send a follow-up email to the interviewer ( CORRECT)
questions.explanation: The interviewer is most likely interviewing many candidates for the position. Sending a follow-up email reminds the interviewer of your discussion and can help set you apart from other candidates.

questions.question: 5. What should you research about an organization before an interview? Select three answers.
questions.explanation: You should review the organization’s mission, vision, and their core values before an interview. Interviewers want to know that you’re a good match for their team and that you value the things that are important to the company.

questions.question: 1. What type of interview questions can the STAR method help you answer? Select all that apply.
questions.explanation: The STAR method is a technique used to answer behavioral and situational interview questions.

questions.question: 2. Which of the following practices can help you answer interview questions clearly and effectively?
choices: Attempt to finish the interviewer’s question before it is asked to show initiative and technical understanding.
Refer to your knowledge of the NIST Cybersecurity framework after responding to each question.
Include a question for the interviewer in your response.
Listen carefully and consider each question before responding.
correct_answers: Listen carefully and consider each question before responding.
questions.explanation: Carefully listening and considering each question before responding during an interview allows you to fully understand what is being asked of you. This allows you to answer each question clearly and effectively.

questions.question: 3. A hiring manager interviews you for a cybersecurity analyst role. They ask you to tell them about a time you were tasked with handling a difficult challenge. What strategy could you use to provide a thoughtful and thorough response?
questions.explanation: The STAR method is a common technique to help interviewees answer behavioral and situational questions during a job interview.

questions.question: 4. The STAR method is a technique used to help interviewees respond to situational and behavioral questions during an interview. What does the ‘S’ in STAR stand for?
questions.explanation: The ‘S’ in STAR stands for situation. This element of the STAR method allows the interviewee to explain the scenario they were put in that led them to make certain on-the-job decisions

questions.question: 5. Fill in the blank: The _____ Method is a technique used to answer behavioral and situational interview questions.
questions.explanation: The STAR Method is a technique used to answer behavioral and situational interview questions. This method can help you develop a thoughtful and thorough response to open-ended interview questions by analyzing a situation, task, action, and result (STAR).

questions.question: 1. Fill in the blank: Elevator pitches enable you to summarize your experience, skills, and background  to potential employers in about ____.
questions.explanation: Elevator pitches enable you to summarize your experience, skills, and background to potential employers in about 60 seconds. An elevator pitch gets its name because it should be short enough to be shared in the average amount of time you might spend with someone on an elevator.

questions.question: 2. What are effective strategies to use when sharing your elevator pitch? Select two answers.
choices: Describe the technical skills that you plan to learn.
Mention mistakes you made at previous jobs.
questions.explanation: When sharing your elevator pitch, it’s important that you highlight your skills succinctly, while speaking at a relaxed pace.

questions.question: 3. In which of the following scenarios would it be appropriate to share your elevator pitch? Select two answers.
choices: At the end of a job interview
When introducing yourself to career and business connections
When meeting new friends or colleagues
After you receive a job offer
correct_answers: When introducing yourself to career and business connections
When meeting new friends or colleagues
questions.explanation: An elevator pitch is a great tool to use to quickly share your experience, skills, and background. It is appropriate for you to deliver your elevator pitch when introducing yourself to career and business connections and when meeting new friends or colleagues.

questions.question: 4. What is a best practice when sharing your elevator pitch with a potential employer?
choices: Disclose why you left your previous job
Use a lot of technical terms
questions.explanation: Presenting your elevator pitch in a conversational tone will help keep potential employers engaged and interested in what you are saying.

questions.question: 1. Which factor should a job seeker consider when writing their resume for a role in the cybersecurity field?
choices: The job they are applying for
The job they want five years from now
correct_answers: The job they are applying for
questions.explanation: Your name (CORRECT) Your education Your professional title (CORRECT) Your summary statement (CORRECT)

questions.question: 2. Which personal details should be included at the top of your resume? Select three answers.
questions.explanation: professional references section skills section (CORRECT) cybersecurity experience section responsibilities section

questions.question: 3. Fill in the blank: After the name and summary section, the next part of your resume is the _____.
questions.explanation: skills cybersecurity queries responsibilities (CORRECT) firewall installation

questions.question: 4. Fill in the blank: You should provide a list of your _____ underneath each job entry in the work experience section of your resume.
questions.explanation: Python the job you are applying for (CORRECT) social engineering previous work experiences

questions.question: 5. Fill in the blank: Under the education/certification section of your resume, you should list any subjects you studied related to _______.
choices: the job you are applying for
correct_answers: the job you are applying for
questions.explanation: 20 10 (CORRECT) five three

questions.question: 6. Fill in the blank: Resumes typically list your last _____ years of work experience.
questions.explanation: Dressing in casual clothing Memorizing your resume Reviewing the job description (CORRECT) Checking the company’s stock price

questions.question: 7. Fill in the blank: _____ is a good way to begin preparing for a job interview.
questions.explanation: nervousness Linux programming issues confusion about interview questions technical issues (CORRECT)

questions.question: 8. Fill in the blank: Testing your video and audio settings before a video conference interview will help you correct any _____ before the interview.
questions.explanation: During your first interaction by phone, email, or video conference (CORRECT) During the second round of interviews During the technical interview On your first day of employment

questions.question: 9. When do you begin to build rapport with your potential employer?
choices: During your first interaction by phone, email, or video conference
During the second round of interviews
On your first day of employment
correct_answers: During your first interaction by phone, email, or video conference
questions.explanation: Situation Action Result (CORRECT) Task

questions.question: 10. A potential candidate is interviewing for a security analyst role. The candidate says the following when responding to a scenario-based question: “The outcome led to an increase in total sales over the two months that my manager was out of the office.” Which part of the STAR method does this response demonstrate?
questions.explanation: Collaboration skills (CORRECT) Written and verbal communication skills (CORRECT) Attention to detail (CORRECT) Social media skills

questions.question: 11. What are examples of skills that are transferable to a cybersecurity role? Select three answers.
questions.explanation: contact information professional references work history (CORRECT) Linux programming skills

questions.question: 12. Fill in the blank: In the experience section of your resume, you should list your _____.
questions.explanation: Contact information Education/Certifications (CORRECT) Skill competencies Work experience

questions.question: 13. Which of the following sections should be included at the bottom of your resume?
questions.explanation: Download the software specified by the interviewer in advance (CORRECT) Request an in-person interview instead Download the video conference software that you are familiar with instead Inform the interviewer that you do not know how to use this particular software

questions.question: 14. A hiring manager recently reached out to you for a video interview. You have never used the software required for you to join the interview. What should you do to prepare?
choices: Download the software specified by the interviewer in advance
Download the video conference software that you are familiar with instead
Inform the interviewer that you do not know how to use this particular software
correct_answers: Download the software specified by the interviewer in advance
questions.explanation: Rapport (CORRECT) Social networking Social engineering Phishing

questions.question: 15. Which term describes a friendly relationship in which the people involved understand each other’s ideas and communicate well with each other?
questions.explanation: cover letter standard framework curriculum vitae (CORRECT) professional reference

questions.question: 16. Fill in the blank: A resume might also be referred to as a  _____.
questions.explanation: Your strengths and relevant skills (CORRECT) Your professional references’ names and email addresses Specific words from the responsibilities section of the job description (CORRECT) Your professional title

questions.question: 17. Which details should your resume’s summary statement include? Select two answers.
choices: Your professional references’ names and email addresses
Specific words from the responsibilities section of the job description
correct_answers: Specific words from the responsibilities section of the job description
questions.explanation: Conducted monthly vulnerability assessments (CORRECT) Security tasks were handled Tasked with handling security challenges Collaborated with a team of six to develop training for more than 25 company employees (CORRECT)

questions.question: 18. Which of the following statements is suitable to include in the work experience section of a resume? Select two answers.
choices: Collaborated with a team of six to develop training for more than 25 company employees
correct_answers: Collaborated with a team of six to develop training for more than 25 company employees
questions.explanation: “Partially fulfilled” “In progress” (CORRECT) “Incomplete” ”Completed”

questions.question: 19. You are currently working on completing a certificate program and will complete the program soon. How should you indicate that in the certification/education section of your resume?
questions.explanation: Action Result Situation (CORRECT) Task

questions.question: 20. A potential candidate is interviewing for a security analyst role. The candidate says the following when responding to a scenario-based question: “My manager took time off from the organization and nominated me to take their place.” Which part of the STAR method does this response demonstrate?
questions.explanation: Programming skills (CORRECT) Your email address Security frameworks (CORRECT) A history of previous work experiences

questions.question: 21. What can the skills section of your resume include? Select two answers.
choices: A history of previous work experiences
questions.explanation: Review your notes on the NIST Framework to refresh your memory (CORRECT) Review the job description (CORRECT) Practice speaking about the experiences and skills that the employer is looking for (CORRECT) Research the company’s former Chief Financial Officer (CFO)

questions.question: 22. What are effective ways to prepare for your job interview? Select three answers.
choices: Review your notes on the NIST Framework to refresh your memory
Practice speaking about the experiences and skills that the employer is looking for
Research the company’s former Chief Financial Officer (CFO)
correct_answers: Review your notes on the NIST Framework to refresh your memory
Practice speaking about the experiences and skills that the employer is looking for
questions.explanation: Write a cover letter Test your video and audio settings (CORRECT) Find a quiet location in your home (CORRECT) Build a rapport with the interviewer

questions.question: 23. Which steps are essential when preparing for a video interview? Select two answers.
choices: Test your video and audio settings
Find a quiet location in your home
Build a rapport with the interviewer
correct_answers: Test your video and audio settings
Find a quiet location in your home
questions.explanation: location-based grammatical (CORRECT) technical cybersecurity

questions.question: 24. Fill in the blank: It is important to make sure there are no _____ errors in your resume before sending it to potential employers.
questions.explanation: summary statement professional references skills (CORRECT) technical programming

questions.question: 25. Fill in the blank: The _____ section of your resume should list capabilities that are related to the position you are applying to.
questions.explanation: Check that your resume uses at least 2 font colors Ensure your resume is a maximum of 2 pages long (CORRECT) Check for spelling and grammatical errors (CORRECT) Ensure your resume is a minimum of 3 pages long

questions.question: 26. Before finalizing your resume, which of the following best practices should you follow? Select two answers.
choices: Check that your resume uses at least 2 font colors
Ensure your resume is a maximum of 2 pages long
Check for spelling and grammatical errors
Ensure your resume is a minimum of 3 pages long
correct_answers: Ensure your resume is a maximum of 2 pages long
Check for spelling and grammatical errors
questions.explanation: take a few deep breaths (CORRECT) review other job postings call your professional references review Linux commands

questions.question: 27. Fill in the blank: To calm your nerves before the interview begins, _____ and remind yourself about the preparation you have put in.
questions.explanation: It can help ease nervousness during the interview (CORRECT) It can distract the interviewer It can help enhance the communication between you and the interviewer (CORRECT) It can reduce your chances of getting hired

questions.question: 28. Why is building rapport important in the job interview process? Select two answers.
choices: It can help ease nervousness during the interview
It can help enhance the communication between you and the interviewer
It can reduce your chances of getting hired
correct_answers: It can help ease nervousness during the interview
It can help enhance the communication between you and the interviewer
questions.explanation: In conclusion, this cybersecurity program offers a holistic and practical journey through the diverse domains of cybersecurity, equipping participants with a robust skill set to tackle the evolving challenges in the field. Through a meticulous blend of theoretical knowledge and hands-on applications, learners gain proficiency in fundamental areas such as networking, operating systems, and threat modeling, progressing to advanced topics like incident response, network security, and security controls. The program not only imparts technical expertise but also hones critical thinking, communication, and collaboration skills crucial for a successful cybersecurity career. The emphasis on real-world scenarios, industry tools, and engagement with the cybersecurity community ensures that participants are well-prepared for the dynamic and ever-changing landscape of cybersecurity. As participants complete the program, they emerge with a comprehensive understanding of cybersecurity principles and practices, ready to make meaningful contributions to the field.

course: Course 8 – Put It to Work: Prepare for Cybersecurity Jobs
